result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul C Koehn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul C Koehn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:23 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Todd Snow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Snow - defendant will enter a plea and recites offer - upon plea will recommend a fine and costs and DNA sample.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Snow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$3,000 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:32 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:06 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Todd Snow present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Snow - will be a plea, and still trying to contact a probation agent to check some things out.  Court sets for Plea & sentencing on June 14, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:07 p.m.
Status hearing on April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

11:58 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Todd Snow present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Snow - still in discussions and requests another court date.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 5, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:59 a.m.

Defendant is to have no contact with Colette H.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court will allow defendant to go to the residence one time, with a law enforcement officer, to get any belongings he may need and to remove the trap set on the property.  Court allows defendant to be on the property on the other side of the road where traps are set.  EXCEPTION - Court allows contact with the attorneys present.

Defendant is to have no contact with Colette H.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court will allow defendant to go to the residence one time, with a law enforcement officer, to get any belongings he may need and to remove the trap set on the property.  Court allows defendant to be on the property on the other side of the road where traps are set.  EXCEPTION - Court allows contact with the attorneys present.

8:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Todd Snow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Snow, will waive the preliminary hearing and DA will amend the charges.  State concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Snow and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Snow enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Statement by Atty Snow.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 7, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.  Statement by Atty Snow in regards to bond and requests bond be amended to allow contact for purposes of litigation.  No objection by DA.  Court will allow contact with the attorneys present.  All other conditions remain. 

Court adjourned at 8:47 a.m.

10:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Todd Snow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Snow - requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled and requests the bond be modified to no violent contact.  Statement by DA - has no objection for defendant to go to residence one more time with law enforcement.  Further argument by Atty Snow.  Court denies the defendant's motion and orders victim to go to the Christine Ann center and fill out the proper paperwork and file with the DA's office or attorney Snow for the court to review.  Court sets for Preliminary hearing on February 15, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:15 a.m.

Defendant is to have no contact with Colette H.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court will allow defendant to go to the residence one time, with a law enforcement officer, to get any belongings he may need and to remove the trap set on the property.  Court allows defendant to be on the property on the other side of the road where traps are set.
Defendant appeared by video from the Green Lake County Jail.

Defendant is to have no contact with Colette H.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court will allow defendant to go to the residence one time, with a law enforcement officer, to get any belongings he may need and to remove the trap set on the property.  Court allows defendant to be on the property on the other side of the road where traps are set.

1:05  p.m.  Defendant in custody, by video, with Atty Todd Snow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Snow confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000 signature bond and conditions of:   Defendant is to have no contact with Colette H.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Discussion held regarding traps defendant currently has set on the property and adjacent property.  Court will allow defendant to go to the residence one time, with a law enforecment officer, to get any belongings he may need and to remove the trap set on the property.  Defendant is allowed to go onto the property on the other side of the road.  Court instructs defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for status hearing.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.
